title: See the trailers for this week's new movies — VIDEO
text:
See the trailers for this week's new movies — VIDEO See the trailers for this week's new movies — VIDEO 
(The Walk/Facebook) Like Neon Las Vegas on Facebook: By Christopher LawrenceLas Vegas Review-Journal Here’s a look at this week’s new releases, “The Martian,” “The Walk,” “Sicario” and “Hell and Back”: 
THE MARTIAN Presumed dead and left behind on Mars , astronaut Mark Watney (Matt Damon) must stay alive long enough to be rescued in this drama from director Ridley Scott. At multiple locations. (142 min.) PG-13; some strong language, injury images, and brief nudity. 
THE WALK French high-wire artist Philippe Petit (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) traverses the void between the twin towers of the World Trade Center in this 3-D drama from director Robert Zemeckis. At multiple locations. (123 min.) PG; thematic elements involving perilous situations, and for some nudity, language, brief drug references and smoking. 
SICARIO An elite task force tries to stop the flow of drugs in a U.S.-Mexican border area in this drama starring Emily Blunt, Benicio Del Toro and Josh Brolin. At multiple locations. (121 min.) R; strong violence, grisly images, and language. 
HELL AND BACK When their best friend (voiced by Rob Riggle) is dragged to hell, two guys (Nick Swardson, TJ Miller) fight to get him back in this stop-motion animated adult comedy. At multiple locations. (86 min.) R; pervasive strong crude and sexual content, language and some drug use.
